DataElement.preferredName: Dose Integer::25 Gray Planning Target Percentage Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text classification for the percentage of an anatomic area within the Planning Target Volume (PTV) that receives a dose of 25 Gray (Gy).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Dose Integer::25 Gray Percentage Planning Target Volume
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._A number with no fractional part.::25_The SI derived unit of absorbed radiation dose. One gray is equal to an absorbed dose of one joule per kilogram of matter; one gray equals 100 rads. The unit is named for the British physician L. Harold Gray, an authority on the use of radiation in the treatment of cancer._Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:A number with no fractional part.::25:The SI derived unit of absorbed radiation dose. One gray is equal to an absorbed dose of one joule per kilogram of matter; one gray equals 100 rads. The unit is named for the British physician L. Harold Gray, an authority on the use of radiation in the treatment of cancer.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A SI derived unit of absorbed radiation dose. One gray is equal to an absorbed dose of one joule per kilogram of matter, or to 100 rads.

Property.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Planning Target Volume Dose Percentage Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed._Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Minor Variation (90% less than or equal Dose 25Gy less than 95%)
Acceptable (Dose 25Gy more than or less than 95%)

A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center Cyberknife protocol
